headline: Trump says Lachlan and Rupert Murdoch might invest in TikTok deal
summary: The Trump administration has been talking up a potential TikTok deal this weekend, with President Donald Trump telling Fox News on Sunday that Rupert Murdoch and his son Lachlan are "probably" going to be involved.

raw.headline: Trump says Lachlan and Rupert Murdoch might invest in TikTok deal
raw.summary: The Trump administration has been talking up a potential TikTok deal this weekend, with President Donald Trump telling Fox News on Sunday that Rupert Murdoch and his son Lachlan are "probably" going to be involved.

headline: Trump Says Murdochs Likely to Be Part of TikTok U.S. Investor Consortium
summary: The White House says it expects a deal for the new ownership structure to be signed in the coming days.

raw.headline: Trump Says Murdochs Likely to Be Part of TikTok U.S. Investor Consortium
raw.summary: The White House says it expects a deal for the new ownership structure to be signed in the coming days.

headline: Trump Says TikTok Investor Group Includes Murdochs, Ellison, and Dell
summary: President Trump said Lachlan Murdoch and his father Rupert "are probably going to be in the group" of American investors buying the U.S. version of the video-sharing platform TikTok.  The group also likely includes tech billionaires Larry Ellison and Michael Dell, Trump told Fox News' The Sunday Briefing in an interview that aired on Sunday.  Trump recently extended the deadline for China-based ByteDance to find a buyer for the U.S. platform of TikTok or face being banned from U.S. app stores.

headline: Popular Hedge Fund Options Strategy Attracts Contrarian Bets
summary: Now, some investors are taking the other side of the wager.  The US equity market has been deceptively calm since the start of August, with 60-day realized volatility the lowest since before the pandemic.  The go-to measure of market gyrations, the Cboe Volatility Index, has been stuck below its long-term average of 20 since mid-June.

headline: Fears of a Tech Bubble Have It Backward. Stocks Can Keep Going.
summary: The stock market may be feeling a little bubbly, but it is nothing like the parabolic, internet-hyped tech trade of the late 1990s.  Back then, “the price performance was insane,” said Dan Greenhaus, strategist at Solus Alternative Asset Management.  Today’s major tech companies are pricey, but nowhere close to “dot-com bubble valuations,” Greenhaus said.

headline: Microsoft: No Big Catalyst In Sight Amid AI Bubbling
summary: Microsoft has shown strong AI monetization, but faces slowing enterprise adoption, rising competition, and high valuation risks. Find out why MSFT stock is a hold.
